question: Wimberger ring sign is present in:
exp: Wimberger ring sign - seen in scurvy

question: Painful Pseudoparalysis in an infant is suggestive of:
exp: Pseudoparalysis Definition A voluntary restriction of motion, mainly because of pain, but not due to actual muscular paralysis Causes Scurvy Osteomyelitis Surgery Congenital syphilis

question: A 5 month-old-baby (exclusively cow milk fed) presented to pediatrics OPD with history of crying on touch. Cause may be:
exp: Deficiency of Vitamin C Sub periosteal hemorrhage involving long bones- crying on touch

question: A 5-month-old baby (exclusively cow feed) presented to pediatric OPD with history of crying on touch. Cause may be:
exp: Scurvy (Barlow's Disease)--> caused due to the def. of Vit. C, especially in children fed predominantly with heat-treated cow's milk. CLINICAL FEATURES- Gum bleeding Petechiae Irritability Subperiosteal hemorrhage involving long bones- Painful pseudo paralysis, Crying on touch OTHER OPTIONS: Caffey's disease--> bone changes, soft-tissue swelling, and irritability JRA--> joint inflammation & stiffness

question: Primary metabolic bone disorder in scurvy is:
exp: Scurvy- Decreased osteoid matrix formation Osteomalacia- Decreased mineralization Osteoporosis- Decreased bone mass with normal mineralization and osteoid formation Paget's disease- Increased bone resorption
opd: Decreased bone mass with normal mineralization and osteoid formation

question: All are radiologic signs in scurvy EXCEPT:
exp: Wrist widening (splaying), Cupping and fraying occurs in rickets and not in scurvy. Radiological Signs of Scurvy include: Ground-glass appearance of long bones/ Pencil thin coex White line of Frankel on the ends of the shafts of the tibia and fibula Wimberger sign (Sclerotic ring around epiphysis) Trummerfeld zone (poorly formed trabeculae) Pelkan spur at the coical end Subperiosteal hemorrhages scorbutic rosary (swelling of costochondral junctions)

question: Child with frog like position and resistance to move the limbs, is probably suffering from:
exp: It is seen in pseudoparalysis, caused by painful subperiosteal hemorrhage in Scurvy. Rickets- bow legs, wind swept deformity No h/o trauma
